results.title: Sales Development Representative - Mental Health
results.description:
Sesh brings the power of group support to a supportive, therapist-led virtual setting. We are inspired by the power of therapeutic conversation and we work to make it accessible for all. Backed by Polaris and Arch Ventures, Sesh is at the beginning of a huge growth journey.

If you love the thought of strategically selling a platform that transforms access to high-quality mental health care while simultaneously decreasing mental health stigma and supporting people with their diverse emotional needs, this is your dream role

The Sales Development Representative will be responsible for a high volume of outbound efforts, researching and prospecting into target customers, identifying needs, introducing Sesh, and serving as an advocate for the mental health of employees. On a day-to-day basis, you will use phone calls and emails to set appointments and build the overall pipeline. Utilizing Hubspot, you will keep track of all communication, appropriately set tasks and follow up with prospects.

You must feel passionate about the power of community while identifying and thoughtfully connecting with new customers for Sesh. Sesh is growing quickly and is looking for a Sales Development Representative who has the right mix of critical thinking, communication skills, and hustle. This people and process-oriented role requires a burning passion for spreading the power of therapist-led group support and a whole lot of detail orientation and initiative.

More specifically, you will:

  • Qualify inbound leads and generate meetings for Sales Leaders
  • Research current and future trends/initiatives to define and refine outbound strategy
  • Effectively communicate with individuals at all levels in the organization, discussing the value of Sesh to HR executives and stakeholders
  • Working with both field sales and marketing to convert leads into qualified meetings
  • Be responsible for CRM integrity
  • LinkedIn – social selling and lead gen activity
  • HubSpot – manage, organize and update contacts database
  • Consistently work to deadlines and targets
  • Enjoy great teamwork and lots of fun

Requirements

What you bring

  • 1-2 years quota-carrying SDR experience
  • Experience with HubSpot
  • An obsession with managing a clean, efficient CRM
  • Commitment to eliminating barriers to accessing mental healthcare
  • An understanding that diversity in thinking makes work better
  • Openness to feedback and the pursuit of continuous improvement
  • Experience digital health company or high-growth start-up preferred
  • Bonus: You've sold to HR / benefits teams

Benefits

Why you should work with us

Every minute you spend working with us, you’re making a difference - and we make sure you know it. The more we grow, the bigger an impact we’ll have.

If you have a great idea, we listen and figure out what we can do to make it happen. You’ll work with an incredible bunch of passionate people to grow a fast-paced startup at a crucial point in its trajectory.

The job is also amazingly flexible, something we’re working hard to hold onto even as we grow super quickly. We started the business remotely, and now have teammates in 4 cities around the US. We openly welcome working in your PJs or joining us from your outdoor office.

Core Benefits

$75,000-$90,000 annual salary

401(K) + matching program

Newest Apple Equipment

Flexible time off policy

Mental health days

Paid volunteering days

Meaningful equity compensation

$100 month Uber Eats credit

Access to WeWork locations across the US

results.title: Head of Sales
results.description:
About Spot

At Spot, we know that just about everyone thinks insurance has never been cool or exciting. It's boring, complicated, and something we all hope we never use. That’s why we’re turning the insurance industry on its head by building the first lifestyle brand in the insurance world, encouraging our customers to live life to the fullest knowing we've got their back.

Spot is the first insurance company that helps its customers have fun while living their best lives, whether learning how to ski, riding a local mountain bike trail, or training to summit Everest. We cover people’s medical bills when shit hits the fan.

We were founded by avid skiers, cyclists, and outdoor enthusiasts, so we understand the risks that come with the territory. When bad things happen, dealing with insurance can make it worse. We believe our community deserves something better.

With over a million customers and growing, we have no intention of slowing down. ﻿

Our Team

We believe in the importance of culture and community and that teams thrive when working in alignment.

Key Attributes

  1. Visionary
  2. Collaborative
  3. Data obsessed
  4. Problem solving
  5. Results driven
  6. Takes initiative

Key Functional Competencies

  1. Strong leadership and influence skills
  2. Talent development
  3. Adaptability
  4. Analytical

Why This Role Is Important to Us

This position is responsible for delivering Spot’s revenue growth commitments, aligning and managing the aspects of Sales and BDR teams and processes that will drive our revenue growth. This role is pivotal in directly influencing the future of a company, including the GTM strategy and new verticals. As part of Spot’s leadership team, this role will directly report to the Chief Revenue Officer.

Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with CRO to develop, lead and execute strategic Sales initiatives
  • Oversee Spot’s sales development and GTM sales strategy and objectives; developing a robust sales management processes – from pipeline to close
  • Pursue a deep understanding of Spot’s potential Partners and their needs to refine our ICP and GTM strategies over time
  • Collaborate across teams, including Engineering, Product, Marketing, Partner Success, Finance, and Operations, to communicate revenue strategies and adjust priorities according to feedback and company objectives
  • Own processes, metrics, and best practices that yield a high-performance sales team
  • Evangelize the product and personally help close large deals
  • Partner with Revenue leadership to develop annual sales strategies, plans, and tactics to drive revenue, expand the Partner base and maximize short- and long-term revenue potential from existing and future Partners
  • Drive Spot’s vertical/partner development strategy, increasing our market shares and improving our win rates across segments we touch
  • Establish and manage a sustainable, predictable, and scalable sales architecture

Who You Are

  • Motivating and leading teams gets you out of bed in the morning
  • Solving for rapid growth inspires you
  • You have experience building and running high-performance sales team
  • You are a tenacious, hands-on closer
  • You are an expert in identifying and developing customer value - translating functionality into C-level value propositions and positive business outcomes for partners and consumers
  • Your knowledge of sales processes and methodologies teamed with creativity in lead generation helps you to transform opportunities into concrete outcomes, including the efficient use of CRM tools
  • You are intellectually agile; a strategic thinker who can think deeply and quantitatively to solve problems
  • Collaboration is core to who you are
  • You say it like it is

Benefits

  • Medical, Dental & Vision
  • 401k
  • Flexible PTO (Vacation, Sick & Holidays)
  • Parental Leave
  • Fully Remote

results.title: Sr. Client Partner
results.description:
About the Role 

As a Client Partner, you will be a pivotal part in expanding current, strategic accounts at Neocol. The Client Partner has experience in the Salesforce ecosystem with large CMT and high-tech clients with the ability to expand the portfolio of business and services within accounts. 

 

Description of Neocol

Neocol helps subscription companies scale & grow! Advising the world’s most innovative B2B organizations on how to optimize their subscription & billing management and billing processes to gain competitive advantage, promote cross-functional transparency, and provide a superior customer experience.



Client Partner Roles and Responsibilities

 

Portfolio Management/Client Success: Build and maintain a profitable portfolio of accounts by consistently assuring high value solutions for our clients. 

 

  • Solution Delivery Leadership - overall accountability for working with Delivery leadership to align our products and services to foster long-term, sustainable value creation for our clients. Also fostering on-time, on-budget completion of engagements with high-quality outcomes that meet and exceed client expectations. 
  • Client relationship management - building long-term, profitable relationships with key accounts, developing “trusted advisor” relationships with client leadership. 
  • Sales & Account management - facilitating ongoing account growth and management of existing accounts, and proactively managing formal client commitments/agreements (e.g. MSA’s, SOW’s, change orders) at portfolio accounts. 

 

Business Development/Entrepreneurial Skills: Contribute to successful business development activities, working with assigned Business Development resources and Marketing, by helping build awareness of the brand, qualifying and proposing new business, and successfully closing new business at both net new and existing accounts. 

 

  • Guiding/driving the development of compelling and market relevant proposals, including writing, reviewing and approving proposals and associated estimates. 
  • Building/leveraging productive relationships with alliance partner resources (e.g. Salesforce AE’s, Sales leadership, etc.).
  • Developing, reviewing, refining client engagement documents (e.g. Master Agreements, Statements of Work, Change Orders, etc.). 

 

Operations/Profitability Management: supporting the attainment of profitability goals for the overall company, focusing on portfolio accounts, by effectively managing overall cost, revenue, and company financial drivers, assuring: 

 

  • Account/Client revenue and profitability goals.
  • Project Profitability goals – costs incurred to deliver an engagement vs. invoiced and collected revenue.
  • Timely invoicing / collections – attainment of DSO and cash flow goals.

 

Resource Management and Development: Support the effective management/allocation of resources, fostering attainment of utilization and contribution goals.

 

  • Managing/overseeing the involvement of resources on client engagements, including compliance with project commitments and professional agreements.
  • Development / coaching of resources – working with Service Delivery and Business Development leaders to provide guidance to professionals to assure quality of service delivery and development of our team members.
  • Participate in / facilitate recruiting and retention activities.



Professional Skills: Creating and fostering an environment that facilitates high performance work teams with both client and company personnel.

 

  • Communication, organization and leadership – consistently demonstrating a positive example for our team and at the client, in both actions and words; consistently staying above the line and promoting a productive work environment.
  • Act in self directed manner - setting and attaining goals that align with overall business and client objectives with minimal supervision.
  • Mentoring our personnel – providing guidance for their professional development and career.
  • Demonstrating our core values on a consistent basis.




Required Technical and Professional Expertise

  • Extensive experience in leading the successful delivery of Salesforce projects and supporting account teams in meeting sales and account growth goals
  • Ability to quickly assess client situation, needs and opportunities, and define/shape our solution approaches to meet specific client requirements, reflecting industry vertical, business priorities, and desired outcomes - you may also use Pre-sales engineering team to assist.
  • Develop trusted advisor relationships with clients, and alignment solution delivery with realization of measurable business value.
  • Effectively developing the skills and capabilities of project managers and engagement leaders.
  • Sets priorities, goals, and timetables to achieve maximum productivity of self and team.
  • Understanding of professional services operations and management.
  • Participate in Major Account Planning processes; effective management and execution of plans to drive net new business.
  • Foster cooperation and teamwork while participating in a group, working toward solutions that generally benefit all involved parties; creates an atmosphere where timely and high-quality information flows smoothly throughout the team (both internal and external) and appropriately adapts to different situations and styles.
  • Communicate thoughts, ideas, recommendations, and perspectives effectively, clearly and concisely verbally, such as presentations, meetings and one-on-one.
  • Demonstrates passion and commitment to achieving personal and professional goals
  • Anticipates potential challenges, issues and opportunities and takes appropriate action to improve, enhance, and drive quality of projects and services.
  • Consistently align words and actions with the values of the organization.
  • Identifies root causes and avoids jumping to conclusions based on insufficient information or knowledge.
  • Appropriately recognizes when to consult with others and/or escalate issues or specific situations to appropriate leadership.
  • Appropriately representing interests of the company to develop strategies for giving on some points and standing firm on others to achieve desired outcomes.
  • Personally seeks to add value in work activities.
  • Works to develop and maintain positive working relationships with co-workers (internal and external) by respecting their time, needs, and opinions, and maintaining a pleasant work attitude.
  • Consistently represents the long-term interests of the company and works to create an environment better than it was before.

 

Benefits/Work Perks

  • Fully remote workforce ensures that you have the tools you need to successfully perform your job and create a proper balance of work and personal life
  • Employer match 401K plan
  • Full health, vision & dental benefit offerings
  • Laptop reimbursement
  • Unlimited PTO and mandatory 1 week of PTO per quarter
  • Mobile & Internet reimbursement
  • Certification achievement salary increases



We hope to hear from you soon!

Please note:

Neocol is an equal opportunity employer. Neocol does not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, arrest or conviction record, marital status, military service or any other characteristic protected by applicable local, state or federal law and reasonably accommodates applicants and employees as required by applicable law.

results.title: Payroll Specialist
results.description:
About us

GoGlobal is the world’s fastest growing, privately owned Global Employer of Record (EOR) service provider with a globally distributed and remote workforce.

GoGlobal’s technology-enabled EOR solution allows businesses of all sizes and geographies to hire staff globally without the need to set up a local entity, opening new doors to rapid expansion and growth. GoGlobal clients can hire top talent anywhere in the world – quickly, cost effectively and compliantly

Why now

The pandemic has shown that people can be just as productive without a commute and that talent is global, not within close proximity to an office. We believe that this societal shift will continue indefinitely, and companies and potential candidates will need organizations like us to help them “GoGlobal.”

Why GoGlobal and how we’re different

  • We’re private: We totally respect that many companies raise a lot of capital and we applaud these successes. At GoGlobal, we simply like people actually in the business to control the business.
  • We’re not a rocket ship: We’re pretty happy on earth. Growth isn’t everything.
  • We’re not a tech company: We fundamentally believe that this industry cannot be replaced by tech in the foreseeable future and it’s the people that make the difference.
  • We’re profitable: We’re pretty prudent in how we spend money because we’re managing our business without outside investors. That said, we’re profitable and continue to grow sustainably. We sleep better at night knowing that we don’t have to raise money. Maybe it’s a little old school, but we believe businesses should be profitable to survive long term.
  • We’re diverse. No, really, we are. Compare the “Our People” page on our website to others you know. We think you’ll agree!
  • We’re transparent: Every month we openly share our strategy and financials, so you feel ownership of your role in the company’s success.
  • We’re structured as a partnership versus a corporation: We’re the only EOR in the world that’s structured this way, allowing us to attract some of the best talent since everyone has the opportunity to be a partner in the firm.
  • We are the scrappy underdog: We think it’s more fun to be a pirate than to be in the navy.

 

Job Description

 

  • We are looking for a Payroll Specialist for EMEA region. This position is fully remote and can be located anywhere in EMEA.
  • Handle (preparing and/or reviewing) all aspects of daily payroll function related to the EMEA region from onboarding new joiners, coordinate payroll processing, calculate/validate/compile payroll report; ensure timely, accurate salary payment to employees and statutory payments to relevant authorities.
  • Coordinate and manage service providers to meet requirement from clients and clients' employees.
  • Develop procedures and documentation, continuously improve the process to optimize efficiency and productivity.
  • Research, monitor and document changes of statutory acts, labour, employment act in EMEA to ensure compliance with local requirements.
  • Master relevant Payroll / Leave / Expense systems
  • Process leaves and claims in line with clients’ policies and procedures, and statutory requirements.
  • Manage payroll metrics and client (including clients’ employees) satisfaction rate to meet company’s goal.
  • For Senior Associate: Coach junior team member(s), provide positive and motivation to team members locally or remotely.
  • Complete any periodic or ad-hoc duties/reports when requested by superiors.
  • Payroll experience in the DACH region
  • Payroll experience in Benelux region
  • Additional European languages besides English are considered a plus.

 

 

 

Requirements

Technical Capacities:

  • Minimum 2 years (for Junior) or 5 years (for Senior Associate) of payroll experience in the EMEA region.
  • Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration or equivalent.
  • Strong in English, written and verbal communication.
  • Being located in Europe.
  • Experience with Office (Word, Excel), Office 365, SharePoint.

Personal Abilities:

  • Excellent organizational and interpersonal abilities.
  • Computer literate.
  • Pro-active and good communication.
  • Positive attitude and flexible mindset.
  • Capable to conduct detail-oriented activities.
  • Self-motivated and trustworthy.
  • Ability to work independently and under tight schedule.


Nice to have:

  • Additional European languages besides English are considered a plus.

results.title: Product Enablement Specialist (Accounting & Financial Software/ SaaS)
results.description:
Are you a motivated and passionate self starter? Are you business minded and love empowering customers? Do you understand business needs, and have prior experience in Accounting/ Finance?

We’re in search of an enthusiastic, dynamic Product Enablement Specialist (Accounting & Financial Software/ SaaS) with a proactive customer focused mindset to join our awesome Customer Experience Team. To date, we have had great success with our customers (98% retention - just saying!) and this is a key objective to maintain/ increase in the years to come, so a key focus (no pun intended) of this role will be on building and maintaining enduring customer relationships.

As the Product Enablement Specialist, you’ll have the opportunity to work across multiple accounts, technologies, projects; providing customers what they need to get started using their new product(s).

You’ll be a part of a team who guide both new customers, as well as current customers, who have purchased new products. You’ll work with a small team working to set customers up for success through a combination of training in important concepts, best practices, and hands-on exercises in their software environment.

What you'll need to blow our customers away:

  • Experienced with financial reporting including P&L, Balance Sheets, Cash Flow & Budgets.
  • Created or been deeply involved in the creation of product training content.
  • Led training offerings with internal or external audiences.

What you'll do to create a seamless customer experience:

  • Train and present product concepts in an interesting and engaging way.
  • Manage customers communications, including scheduling engagements.
  • Provide customers walkthrough of product UI.
  • Train customer how to best utilize tools (separately and when used together).
  • Help customers configure products according to their needs.
  • Flag risk/challenges, provide recommendations.
  • Provide best practices guidance on using products.
  • Connect with customers with clarity and courtesy – verbally and in writing.
  • Work with customers across media such as video calls, phone conferences, email, chat.
  • Efficiently balance multiple requests from multiple customers.
  • Collaborate with other team members on technical and/or customer service challenges.
  • Internal team training and enablement on new or updated product features and capabilities.

This role can be based in our Costa Mesa office or Remote

Depending on experience, this position typically pays between $105,000 - $120,000/yr.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or Business.
  • 3 years prior enablement experience.
  • 7+ years working in SaaS company in Professional Services, Enablement, Solutions, Implementations or other roles.
  • High level of business acumen and are comfortable speaking to common practices.
  • You’ve work in technical environments while not necessarily being a technical expert.
  • Project management experience helpful.
  • You’re naturally motivated to resolve problems. You can jump in and own It.
  • You give back more. You find ways to build and grow customers and colleagues.
  • You’re autonomous and driven; committed to awesome.
  • You do the right thing for your customer and for your colleagues.
  • Excellent interpersonal, team cooperation, and communication skills.
  • You can communicate with partners across the business at different levels.
  • Ability to efficiently prioritize many competing requests.
  • Performs work with (internal and external) customer happiness in mind, while not compromising the integrity of the work.

Benefits

  • Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
  • Retirement Plan (401k, IRA)
  • Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
  • Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
  • Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)
  • Short Term & Long Term Disability
  • Training & Development
  • Work From Home
  • Wellness Resources
  • Stock Option Plan

 

Phocas is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.

results.title: Financial Services CSA
results.description:
Company Description

 

Salary: £21,000 to £23,000 depending on experience plus an additional £500 on passing probation
Hours: 40 hours across 5 days per week (We're open 8am to 8.30pm Monday to Friday & 8:45am to 4:30pm Saturdays)Location: Work from home (UK only) 
Location: Home Working

Hello, we’re UW

We’re the UK’s only genuine multi-service provider, providing energy, broadband, mobile and home insurance to over 750,00 customers. 

Our goal is to double in size over the next five years so we need lots more great people to join us in our journey. 

Everybody matters at UW. We embrace different perspectives, life experiences and personalities in an inclusive environment where people can have fun and grow together. 

Although we’re a FTSE 250 company and have been around for 25 years, we still have a small company feel and the culture of a start-up. You’ll be joining a bunch of genuinely friendly people who love working together and really want to make a difference. 

The role - be the voice of UW 

Skip the commute and work from home as part of an award-winning customer care team 

You’ll be the person who gives us a voice and connects us to our customers. 

You’ll help to solve our customers’ problems, providing them with support, advice and the peace of mind that their query will be resolved.  

We won’t lie - it’s not always an easy role.  You’ll need to be willing to deal with challenging and vulnerable customers, there is a lot to learn and things are always changing.  But we’ll give you all the training you need when you join and then once you are part of a team, you’ll have people around you for continued learning and encouragement. 

You’ll work towards a number of KPIs such as:

  • Compliance Transfer rate
  • Customer satisfaction
  • Calls per hour
  • Smart metres booked 
  • Home Insurance quote conversion

Who we’re looking for

We’re looking for people with great customer service skills who enjoy resolving customer issues. Ideally, you will currently or have previously worked in a contact centre/call centre role. 

We also want you to be: 

  • A great listener who remains calm under pressure
  • Someone who loves working in a fast-paced and changing environment
  • Motivated and keen to meet goals and targets 

You will be able to demonstrate:

  • Responsibility
  • Integrity
  • Efficiency

What you’ll need

We will supply the equipment needed for you to do the role but you will still need a strong internet connection.  Our minimum speed requirement is 25Mbps Download and 4 Mpbs Upload.

You will also need a dedicated, quiet work space with a work station, plenty of natural light, access to fresh air and no distractions. This cannot be a communal space that is shared by other household members.  

You’ll also need to be currently residing in the UK with eligibility to live and work in the UK too. 

Why work for us? 

So many reasons! As an award-winning FTSE 250 company we offer stability, recognition and career growth. We offer a great benefits package including:   

  • £21,000 to £23,000 depending on experience plus an additional £500 on passing probation
  • 33 days holiday including Bank Holidays (Bank holidays open 10am to 4pm)
  • Discounts on UW products & services
  • Share options and Save As You Earn Scheme 
  • General Life Insurance up to 4 x your salary
  • Employee Assistance Programme including free counselling and legal advice 
  • Free virtual GP service plus discounts on healthcare and medical cash plans

Apply here !  

If you think this is the role for you and want to be part of UW’s extraordinary growth, apply now. 

 

Additional Information
 

We provide equal opportunities, a diverse and inclusive work environment, and fairness for everyone. You are welcome to apply no matter your age, disability, gender, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity status, race, religion or belief, or sexual orientation.

Please note, if you are applying for a role which involves having access to personal data, you will be subject to a background check. Where checks are unsatisfactory or incomplete and/or a failure to reveal information relating to convictions that you are required to identify as part of the background checks, could lead to withdrawal of an offer of employment.

results.title: Enterprise Account Manager
results.description:
Inside Real Estate is a fast-growing, profitable, privately-held company and a technology leader in the real estate industry. In an industry where fluctuation is often the norm, we don’t merely adapt. We create. We innovate. We lead. We discover solutions to new challenges and make something remarkable. We are on a mission to simplify workflows for Real Estate companies around the country, and we are looking to add to our team.

An Enterprise Account Manager is responsible for the success of their book of business. Your mission is to help customers grow by driving value and providing creative solutions to their business problems using our strong portfolio of products and services. Success is measured by specific key performance indicators such as client adoption, engagement, growth and retention individually and as a department.


Responsibilities
  • Consistently achieve quarterly growth and retention goals
  • Own overall relationship with the customer post sale
  • Drive adoption and engagement through consulting and strategizing with your clients through meaningful touchpoints like business reviews.
  • Analyze client use-cases and recommend best practices to optimize product usage, adoption and ROI
  • Ability to manage and prioritize customer requests and internal responsibilities to meet KPI’s, (Retention, Growth and Adoption)
  • Work with onboarding managers and implementation to ensure a seamless transition into live status.
  • Effectively manage a high volume of inbound customer requests, align them with internal resources and anticipate their business needs.
  • Identify challenges and engage in proactive client meetings to positively impact customer loyalty and to align business goals
  • Work collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders
